SD lawmakers are pushing forward a bill to keep educators from acknowledging the existence of transgender people.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

South Dakota lawmakers are once again attacking transgender youth. This time, the proposal would prevent educators from even acknowledging the existence of transgender people.

The reality is that trans people are in our classrooms as teachers, students, and parents. This bill will be taken up by the Senate State Affairs Committee on Friday, February 22. Contact your senator today and tell them that trans people will not be erased and to vote no on House Bill 1108.

This attack is clearly fueled by a fear and misunderstanding of transgender youth in our state. We should be working together to make South Dakota a place where all students – including transgender students – can get a great education. Instead, some lawmakers are spending time attacking trans youth.

Take Action

We must send a message loud and clear that the attacks on transgender youth in South Dakota must end. This dangerous bill cannot be allowed to pass in our state or anywhere in the nation.

Thank you for standing with us,

Libby Skarin
Policy Director, ACLU of South Dakota
